meanings.sent1: The reverend teacher was admired by all the students.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tree in the park had a reverend presence.
meanings.sent3: The reverend old cat demanded to be petted at all times.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in reverend hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood tall and reverend against the horizon.

meanings.definition: A title of respect for a clergyman.
meanings.sent1: The reverend led the congregation in prayer every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The reverend's sermon touched the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The reverend and the rabbi had a friendly competition in baking pies.
meanings.sent4: The reverend's words were a beacon of hope in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The reverend's kindness was felt by all who crossed his path.
